connector.description:
Query data from a Microsoft SQL Server Database.

In your KameletBinding file, you must explicitly declare the SQL Server driver dependency in spec->integration->dependencies

- "mvn:com.microsoft.sqlserver:mssql-jdbc:<version>"

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.serverNam.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.serverName
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.serverNam.description: The server name for the data source. Example: localhost

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.serverPor.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.serverPort
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.serverPor.description: The server port for the data source.

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.username.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.username
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.username.description: The username to access a secured SQL Server Database

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.password.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.password
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.password.description: The password to access a secured SQL Server Database

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.query.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.query
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.query.description: The query to execute against the SQL Server Database Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.consumedQ.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.consumedQuery
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.consumedQ.description: A query to run on a tuple consumed Example: DELETE FROM accounts where user_id = :#user_id

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.encrypt.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.encrypt
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.encrypt.description: Encrypt the connection to SQL Server.

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.delay.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.delay
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-source.delay.description: The number of milliseconds before the next poll
